label.text: Too Hot to Handle
As part of the Greenhouse effect, carbon dioxide (CO₂) in the Earth’s atmosphere absorbs heat energy.
This is shown in the demonstration presented below.
One plastic bottle is filled with air and the other is filled with approximately 50% CO₂. Both are placed on a hot plate covered in sand for 20 minutes.
The thermometers show the temperature inside each bottle before and at the end of the experiment.

20°C20°C
air50% CO2
29°C43°C
air50% CO2

The diagram below represents a simplified model of the greenhouse effect.
Which process in the simplified model is equivalent to the warming of the gases in the bottles by the sand in the demonstration?
Select one of ‘1’, ‘2’, ‘3’ or ‘4’ to identify the correct process.
CO₂ absorbs and stores heat energy, and then releases the heat energy.
Which one of these terms describes the type of heat transfer that is occurring?
convection
conduction
passive
radiation
The demonstration shows the effect that CO₂ has on the temperature of the Earth’s atmosphere.
CO₂ from a commercial gas cylinder was used in the demonstration.
Much of the CO₂ that is being added to Earth’s atmosphere comes from burning fossil fuels.

Does the difference in the source of the CO₂ have any effect on the validity of this demonstration?
